Register value manipulation API


Typedefs

typedef REGVAL REGVAL

Functions

VOID LEVEL_PINCLIENT::PIN_AssignRegval (REGVAL *regval, const UINT64 *data, UINT size)
VOID LEVEL_PINCLIENT::PIN_ReadRegvalQWord (const REGVAL *regval, UINT64 *val, UINT i)
UINT LEVEL_PINCLIENT::PIN_GetRegvalSize (const REGVAL *regval)

Detailed Description

This API allows the user to manipulate the value of any register. Typically, one would pass a CONTEXT to an analysis routine and then use PIN_GetContextRegval to read from the CONTEXT to a REGVAL object or use PIN_SetContextRegval to write to the CONTEXT from the REGVAL.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct REGVAL REGVAL
 

An opaque structure which holds the value of a register. Use PIN_ReadRegvalQWord for reading the register value in 64-bit chunks. Use PIN_AssignRegval for manipulating the value held by the structure. Use PIN_GetRegvalSize for getting the register's size in bits.

Function Documentation

VOID LEVEL_PINCLIENT::PIN_AssignRegval (  REGVAL *  regval,
const UINT64 *  data,
UINT  size
) 
 

Assign a value of any size to a REGVAL object.

Parameters:
[in,out] regval Pointer to the REGVAL object
[in] data Buffer containing the value to be stored
[in] size Size (in bits) of the value to be stored
Note: The size of the value may be the exact size of the buffer or smaller. For example, an 80-bit register value will be stored using a 128 bit buffer.

Availability:
Mode: JIT
O/S: Linux, Windows & MacOS
CPU: IA-32 and Intel(R) 64 architectures

UINT LEVEL_PINCLIENT::PIN_GetRegvalSize (  const REGVAL *  regval  ) 
 

Get the size in bits of the register value held in the REGVAL object.

Parameters:
[in] regval Pointer to the REGVAL object
Returns:
number of bits of the register held in the REGVAL object
Availability:
Mode: JIT
O/S: Linux, Windows & MacOS
CPU: IA-32 and Intel(R) 64 architectures

VOID LEVEL_PINCLIENT::PIN_ReadRegvalQWord (  const REGVAL *  regval,
UINT64 *  val,
UINT  i
) 
 

Considering the register value as an array of qwords, read the i_th element from that array.

Parameters:
[in] regval Pointer to the REGVAL object
[out] val Pointer to a UINT64 where the i_th value will be stored
[in] i Specifies the qword to return, index zero specifies the least significant word
Availability:
Mode: JIT
O/S: Linux, Windows & MacOS
CPU: IA-32 and Intel(R) 64 architectures
